About | RiverPark Funds Home About Funds News How to Invest Contact Us About RiverPark Who we are History Alignment of Interests Investment Philosophy Our Team Founded in 2006, RiverPark is a financial services group with over $1 billion* in assets under management. RiverPark has decades of experience and success in launching and managing funds both in the public and private capital markets and has built strong back office, middle office and compliance functions. * As of June 30, 2025. History RiverPark was founded in 2006. After initially focusing on institutional separate accounts, RiverPark Advisors, LLC was formed in July 2009 to launch the RiverPark family of mutual funds. RiverPark is 100% privately owned, with a majority held by employees. September 2009 RiverPark launches RiverPark Opportunity Fund as a hedge fund September 2010 RiverPark creates RiverPark Funds Trust RiverPark launches RiverPark Large Growth Fund, RiverPark Short Term High Yield Fund and Wedgewood Fund as
                    mutual funds March 2012 RiverPark converts RiverPark Opportunity Fund to the RiverPark Long/Short Opportunity Fund as a mutual
                    fund September 2013 RiverPark launches RiverPark Strategic Income Fund June 2014 RiverPark launches RiverPark Ventures, L.P. September 2016 RiverPark launches RiverPark Floating Rate CMBS Fund as an interval fund RiverPark launches RiverPark Ventures II, L.P. November 2018 RiverPark converts RiverPark Floating Rate CMBS Fund from an interval fund to a mutual fund October 2019 RiverPark launches RiverPark Ventures III, L.P. July 2022 RiverPark launches RiverPark Ventures IV, L.P. June 2023 RiverPark launches RiverPark/Next Century Growth Fund January 2024 RiverPark launches RiverPark/Next Century Large Growth Fund January 2025 RiverPark launches RiverPark Partners Alignment of Interests RiverPark believes strongly in investing alongside its shareholders. RiverPark portfolio managers and
                  employees collectively have over $25 million invested in our own strategies. Investment Philosophy We are committed to building portfolios with strong fundamentals that aim to provide superior returns over
                  multiple economic cycles. We are differentiated by our long-term perspective and our focus on research-driven
                  strategies. Our Team Morty Schaja Chief Executive Officer and Managing Partner Kenny Gilison Chief Operating Officer and Chief Compliance Officer Matt Kelly Chief Marketing Officer Morty Schaja Chief Executive Officer and Managing Partner × Morty graduated from Tel-Aviv University in 1975 with a BS in Physics and from Columbia University in 1976
                    with an MBA in finance and accounting. From 1977 to 1985, Morty was Vice President for Consulting with Data
                    Resources, Inc., a leading economic consulting and forecasting firm. From 1986 through 1987 he was a Senior
                    Analyst with Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenretteâs Stock Index Department. From 1987 until 1990, Morty was
                    Executive Vice President of First Security, a registered investment advisor and hedge fund. From February
                    1991 through March 2006, Morty had various responsibilities with Baron Capital, leading to his position as
                    President and Chief Operating Officer, where he managed the growth of the firm from $40 million in assets
                    under management to over $15 billion. As CEO and a founding partner of RiverPark Capital, Morty has
                    responsibility for all of the firmâs business activities as well as overseeing the firmâs risk management,
                    compliance and trading infrastructure and participating in the portfolio management process. Kenny Gilison Chief Operating Officer and Chief Compliance Officer × Mr. Gilison received a B.A. from the University of Virginia in 1987 and a J.D., magna cum laude, from the
                    University of California, Hastings College of Law in 1991. Prior to joining RiverPark in April 2014, Kenny
                    served as Managing Principal at Westbrook Partners in charge of all operations in France. Mr. Gilison opened
                    Westbrook's Paris office in 2003 and served on the Investment Committee. Prior to joining Westbrook, Mr.
                    Gilison was Director of Acquisitions and a member of the Executive Committee for STAM Europe, a Paris-based
                    asset management firm working with a variety of private equity funds. Prior to joining STAM Europe, Mr.
                    Gilison was the founder and head of GMAC Commercial Mortgage's Paris office. He joined the company in 1999
                    and was responsible for GMACCM investments throughout Europe. Beginning in 1997, Mr. Gilison was a senior
                    member of the commercial real estate finance team at Deutsche Bank in New York. Prior to that time, Mr.
                    Gilison was a practicing attorney concentrating in structured finance, corporate finance and real estate,
                    most recently at Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom in New York. Matt Kelly Chief Marketing Officer × Matt Kelly joined RiverPark Capital in June of 2010 as a Partner with responsibility for marketing and
                    distributing the firmâs asset management products. Prior to joining RiverPark, Matt was responsible for
                    third-party distribution for the Baron Funds from 1997 to 2010. Matt has been in the mutual fund industry
                    since 1995. He graduated from Lehigh University in 1991. Contact: mkelly@riverparkfunds.com Andy Appelbaum Managing Partner, RiverPark Ventures Conrad van Tienhoven Principal and Portfolio Manager Paul Genova Chief Financial Officer Conrad van Tienhoven Principal and Portfolio Manager × Conrad is the Portfolio Manager of the RiverPark Long/Short Opportunity Fund and the RiverPark Large Growth
                    Fund and has served in these capacities since December 2022. Conrad joined RiverPark at its formation and
                    has acted as Assistant Portfolio Manager on RiverPark Long/Short and RiverPark Large Growth since the
                    inception of those Funds. He led the investments in internet media, ecommerce, hardware, software, and
                    online business services as well as healthcare and healthcare technology. Prior to RiverPark, Conrad spent
                    nine years at Baron Funds focused on these same sectors in various roles including Senior Analyst on the
                    Baron iOpportunity Fund and the Baron Fifth Avenue Growth Fund. Conrad received a B.A. in Economics from the
                    University of Texas at Austin in 1997. Andy Appelbaum Managing Partner, RiverPark Ventures × RiverPark Ventures was formed in April of 2014 to make venture capital investments in high growth, early
                    stage business that we believe have significant opportunities to create leadership positions in their
                    industries. Andy received a BA in Philosophy and Political Science, summa cum laude from SUNY
                    Binghamton in 1988 and a JD from New York University School of Law in 1991. From 1991 through 1992, he was
                    an associate with the New York office of Latham & Watkins, specializing in corporate transactions and
                    restructuring. From 1992 through the present, Andy has been a serial entrepreneur with a focus on creating
                    marketplaces and disrupting inefficient supply chains. The companies he has co-founded have spanned a broad
                    diversity of industries, including technology, energy, food services, e-commerce, media and real estate.
                    Andy is the co-founder of Cleaner Options, Seamless (formerly Seamless Web), mdenergy, Blue Ribbon Partners
                    and domino Media Group. Prior to joining RiverPark Ventures, Andy was an active angel
                    investor. As Managing Partner of RiverPark Ventures, Andy is responsible for all of the fund's business
                    activities including deal sourcing and portfolio management. Paul Genova Chief Financial Officer × Paul received his bachelorâs degree in accountancy from Bentley College in 1999. From 1999 to 2002, Paul
                    was a Senior Auditor for Pustorino, Puglisi and Co., Grant Thornton, LLP and PricewaterhouseCoopers, LLP,
                    whereby he led various high profile audit engagements in their respective capital markets groups. In 2003,
                    Paul joined Exis Capital Management, Inc as a Senior Accountant, a multi-strategy / multi-prime broker /
                    multi-manager hedge fund platform with assets reaching $1.5 billion under management. Within a yearâs time
                    at Exis Capital Management, Inc., Paul was promoted to Controller whereby he was responsible for two
                    master-feeder complex capital structures as well as managing a group of several back office members. Prior
                    to joining RiverPark Capital LLC in May of 2008, Paul spent just under a year and a half as Controller at K
                    Squared Capital Advisors, LP, a high-yield / distressed opportunities hedge fund with approximately $270
                    million in assets under management. Edward L. Shugrue III Managing Director and Portfolio Manager Kristi Caruso Chief Administrative Officer Jim Brophy Head Trader/Research Edward L. Shugrue III Managing Director and Portfolio Manager × Mr. Shugrue is a Managing Director of the Company and a Portfolio Manager for the RiverPark Floating Rate
                    CMBS Fund (RCRIX) which was launched in 2010 and internalized at RiverPark in 2018. Mr. Shugrue has over 30
                    years of commercial real estate investing, lending and restructuring experience as an owner, lender and
                    advisor. Prior to joining RiverPark, Mr. Shugrue served for 15 years as the CEO of Talmage (and its
                    predecessors), an investment manager and special servicer in the CMBS and commercial mortgage loan industry
                    with over $12 billion of relevant investment experience. From 1997 until 2003, Mr. Shugrue co-built one of
                    the country's first commercial real estate mezzanine investment platforms in his capacity as the Chief
                    Financial Officer of Sam Zell's Capital Trust, Inc. (now Blackstone Mortgage Trust). From 1991 to 1996, Mr.
                    Shugrue was one of four people responsible for turning around, taking public and selling River Bank America,
                    a New York bank. From 1988 through 1990, Mr. Shugrue was employed in the real estate group of Bear Stearns &
                    Co. Inc. where he worked on principal, agency and securitization assignments. Mr. Shugrue is a former
                    governor of the Commercial Mortgage Backed Securities Association. He is a guest lecturer at the Harvard
                    Business School (where he wrote a case study) as well as numerous other universities. He has also published
                    articles regarding CMBS in numerous publications including PREA Quarterly and CRE Finance World. Mr. Shugrue
                    is a graduate of the University of Pennsylvania with a BA (honors) in political science and with a degree
                    from the Wharton School. Kristi Caruso Chief Administrative Officer × Kristi received her bachelorâs degree as a teacher for the speech/hearing handicapped from New York
                    University in 1996. From 1996 to 2006, Kristi worked at Baron Capital Inc. rising from a marketing intern to
                    an administrative manager. Her roles included research support, trading operations, and human resource
                    management. From 2006 to 2012, Kristi worked at RiverPark as Head Trader and Office Manager. In 2014 Kristi
                    was named Chief Administrative Officer. Jim Brophy Head Trader/Research × Jim joined RiverPark in 2012 and has over 25 years of securities industry experience as both a buy and
                    sell-side trader. Previously, he was a Managing Director in global equity sales and trading at Canaccord
                    Genuity. From 2005 through 2009, Jim was the Head Trader and a Partner at Arience Capital, a value oriented
                    long/short equity hedge fund with over $1bn in assets under management. He has held roles at Bank of
                    America, ABN Amro, NatWest Markets. Jim is a graduate of the University of Michigan and holds an M.B.A. from
                    New York Universityâs Stern School of Business where he earned a dual major in Finance and International
                    Business. He is passionate about several charitable endeavors including The Princeton Wrestling Club (PWC),
                    where he serves on The Board of Directors, and the Multiple Myeloma Research Foundation (MMRF). In 2016, he
                    climbed Mt. Kilimanjaro with six cancer survivors to raise awareness for multiple myeloma. Kristin Cobb Investor Relations Officer and Compliance Officer Spencer Krug Partner, RiverPark Ventures Danny Cohen Investor, RiverPark Ventures Kristin Cobb Investor Relations Officer and Compliance Officer × Kristin joined RiverPark as an Associate in February 2013. From 2010 to 2012 Kristin was a Compliance and
                    Operations Intern for GLG Ore Hill LLC. In 2011 Ore Hill was acquired by Man Investments Inc., where Kristin
                    then transitioned into a US Institutional Business Development and Investor Relations Management Intern from
                    2012 to 2013. Kristin received her Bachelor's Degree in Organizational Management and Development, with a
                    Finance concentration, from New York University in 2014. Spencer Krug Partner, RiverPark Ventures × Spencer is a Partner at RiverPark Ventures. Spencer is involved with all aspects
                    of RPVâs investment process, with a particular focus on deal sourcing, due diligence, financial modeling and
                    managing portfolio companies. Prior to joining RiverPark, Spencer served as a Consultant with L.E.K., a
                    global management consulting firm, specializing in due diligence projects for private equity firms and
                    corporate strategy engagements. Spencer was also one of the first hires for CampusProtein, a leading sports
                    nutrition marketplace catered to the college demographic. Spencer received his B.S. and M.B.A. from the
                    Indiana University â Kelley School of Business where he studied Accounting and Financial Analysis. While at
                    Indiana, Spencer taught an introductory business course to a cohort of freshman students. Spencer is a
                    licensed Certified Public Accountant (CPA). Danny Cohen Investor, RiverPark Ventures × Danny is an Investor at RiverPark Ventures where he is involved in all aspects of the fundâs investment
                    process. Prior to joining RiverPark, he spent two years in the Business Graduate Program at Thomson Reuters
                    â originally in the Automotive Practice Group and most recently on the Applied Innovation team, the
                    companyâs global growth engine. Danny received his B.A. in Political Science from the University of
                    Michigan. During his sophomore year, he co-founded snack food startup Funkinâ Seeds which he ran with four
                    friends until a successful exit in March 2017. During his time at Michigan, Danny interned at hedge fund
                    Scoggin Capital Management and RPV portfolio company Via Transportation, where he helped launch service
                    expansions to Washington DC and New York-area airports.                     Prior to joining RiverPark, Olga has held various positions in corporate accounting and financial planning
                    and analysis roles with industry leaders such as BlackRock, GFI Group and Bloomberg. Olga joined RiverPark
                    in July 2016 as a Corporate Controller. Tetiana Pyrig Staff Accountant × Prior to joining RiverPark, Tetiana worked at ADW Labs, Inc. from 2010 to 2015 as a Bookkeeper, where she
                    created financial transactions by preparing and analyzing accounting records and financial reports. She was
                    also responsible for processing payroll, preparing invoices, and managed multiple clients, projects and
                    company improvement initiatives. Tetiana received her Bachelorâs Degree in Accounting and Business
                    Administration with a minor in Sociology from Baruch College in 2015. After graduating, she traveled for 6
                    months to 12 different countries. Tetiana joined RiverPark in May 2016. Rachel Kozachkov Receptionist × Rachel received a B.S. in Business Economics from SUNY Albany in 2023. Prior to joining RiverPark, Rachel
                      held several leadership positions at Victoriaâs Secret, including Operations and Teams supervisor. Rachel

                  from Harvard Law School in 1991. From 1991 to 1994, Mitch was an associate with the New York office of Latham
                  & Watkins specializing in corporate finance transactions. From 1994 until joining Baron Capital in November of
                  1995, Mitch was an equity research analyst for Smith Barney in emerging growth stocks. In 1995, Mitch joined
                  Baron Capital as a research analyst covering consumer/retail, gaming/leisure/lodging and real estate. In 1999
                  Mitch was co-portfolio manager for Baron Growth Fund. From the March 2000 inception through March 2006, Mitch
                  was the portfolio manager for the Baron iOpportunity Fund and from the fundâs May 2004 inception to March 2006
                  he was also the portfolio manager of Baron Fifth Avenue Growth Fund, a large cap growth fund. As CIO and a
                  founding partner of RiverPark Capital, Mitch has responsibility for managing the firmâs investment-related
                  research efforts and is the Portfolio Manager of the RiverPark Large Growth Fund and the RiverPark Long/Short

                  mutual fund industry. Matt graduated from Lehigh University in 1991. Contact: mkelly@riverparkfunds.com Close David Sultan Head of Institutional Business Development × David Sultan joined RiverPark Capital in 2017 to lead its institutional business development efforts. Prior
                  to joining RiverPark, David worked at J.P. Morgan Asset Management in the Endowments & Foundations Group where
                  he advised clients about investments in J.P. Morgan strategies across all asset classes. Before that, David
                  provided investment advice to high net worth individuals at J.P. Morgan Private Bank. Previously, David was a
                  long/short portfolio manager in UBS's proprietary U.S. Equities Group focusing on the consumer and retail
                  sectors and worked as a securities analyst at John A. Levin & Co. Prior to that, David spent over a decade at
                  Credit Suisse First Boston as an M&A banker. He also worked as an analyst at McKinsey & Co. David received an
                  AB from Harvard College in 1984 and an MBA from Harvard Business School in 1988. Close Conrad van Tienhoven Principal and Assistant Portfolio Manager × Conrad graduated from the University of Texas with a BA in Economics in 1997. He then joined Baron Capital as

                  analyst on the Baron iOpportunity Fund covering internet media, ecommerce, hardware, software, and online
                  business services. In 2004, in addition to his information technology work, Conrad was made a senior analyst
                  on the Baron Fifth Avenue Growth Fund. In this role, he worked as a generalist in large cap growth ideas.

                  was elected a member of the Sport Business Association and was a member of the UM varsity baseball team his
                  freshman year before an injury ended his playing career. He volunteered at Ann Arborâs C.S. Mott Childrenâs
                  Hospital. Zackâs work experience includes summer stints in marketing for the Portland Diamond Project baseball

Close Home About Funds News How to Invest Contact Us RiverPark Funds 156 West 56th Street, 17th Floor New York, NY 10019 Important Information The RiverPark Funds are distributed by SEI Investments Distribution Co., which is not affiliated with RiverPark Advisors, LLC, Wedgewood Partners, Inc., CrossingBridge Advisors, LLC, Next Century Growth Investors, LLC,  or their affiliates. Check the background of SEI Investments Distribution Co. on FINRA's BrokerCheck RiverPark is the brand name for RiverPark Advisors, LLC and its affiliated investment advisers. Investing involves risk including loss of principal. Accordingly, the purchase of Fund shares should be viewed as a long-term investment. There can be no assurance that a Fund will achieve its stated objectives. Some Funds may use leverage. If the securities decrease in value, a Fund that uses leverage may suffer a greater loss than would have resulted without the use of leverage. To the extent any Fund engages in short sales, losses are potentially unlimited and the expenses involved with the short strategy may impact the performance of the Fund. With the exception of the Wedgewood Fund and the RiverPark Floating Rate CMBS Fund, each Fund is "diversified", as that term is defined in the Investment Company Act of 1940. Bonds and bond funds are subject to credit risk, default risk, and interest rate risk and may decline in value as interest rates rise. High yield bonds involve greater risks of default or downgrade and are more volatile than investment grade securities, due to the speculative nature of their investments. Securities backed by commercial real estate assets are subject to securities market risks similar to those of direct ownership of commercial real estate loans including, but not limited to, declines in the value of real estate, declines in rental or occupancy rates and risks related to general and local economic conditions. In addition to the normal risks associated with investing, international investments may involve risk of capital loss from unfavorable fluctuation in currency values, from differences in generally accepted accounting principles or from social, economic or political instability in other nations. Investments in smaller companies typically exhibit higher volatility. To determine if a Fund is an appropriate investment for you, carefully consider the Fund's investment objectives, risk factors, charges and expenses before investing. This and other information may be found in the Fund's prospectus, which may be obtained by clicking here or calling 1-888-564-4517. Please read the prospectus carefully before investing. © 2020 RiverPark Advisors, LLC. All Rights Reserved.   | Legal Notices | Privacy Policy
